## (b)
Let $w_i = \mu + \tau_i$, $z = (y_{ij}, w_i)^T$, and $\theta = (\mu, \sigma^2_{\tau}, \sigma^2_{\epsilon})^T$. Then, we have
\begin{align*}
l(\theta) &= log f(Z | \theta) - log f(w | Y, \theta)\\
\end{align*}
where
\begin{align*}
w | \theta &\sim N(\mu, \sigma^2_{\tau})\\
z | \theta &\sim N\left(
\begin{bmatrix}
\mu \\
\mu
\end{bmatrix},
\begin{bmatrix}
\sigma^2_{\tau} + \sigma^2_{\epsilon} & \sigma^2_{\tau} \\
\sigma^2_{\tau} & \sigma^2_{\tau}
\end{bmatrix}\right)
\end{align*}
